main event: An observer reported seeing a bright, white light in the sky near Middletown, Pennsylvania on September 12, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a pinhead at arm's length., The observer reported the light made a sharp turn and disappeared behind a tree., It was observed for about three or four minutes, although most of the time it lasted only about three seconds., The object was claimed not to be an aircraft, and there were no local aircraft in the air at the time of the sighting., The weather was clear with twelve miles visibility and calm winds.
